query: what type of stems do I use in this recipe? thick cilantro what should I combine ingredients in? bowl What ingredients do I need for the paste? garlic, ginger, thick cilantro stems, and half of the chili What kind of cooking tool do I need to use to combine the ingredients for the paste? mortar and pestle What should I do with the other half of the chili? Thinly slice remaining half chili and set aside for garnish. what do I need to add 3 tablespoons of? coconut milk What should I do with the fat from the coconut milk? Carefully spoon off about 3 tablespoons of the solid fat from the surface and place it in a large Dutch oven. how long will it take for the coconut fat to separate? about 4 minutes At what heat should the Dutch oven be set to cook the coconut fat? medium-high heat. what else is in the mixture apart from garlic? ginger How should I prepare the scallions and turmeric for this recipe?
text: 2. Open 1 can of coconut milk and carefully spoon off about 3 tablespoons of the solid fat from the surface and place it in a large Dutch oven. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Heat over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until coconut fat separates and solids start to sizzle, about 4 minutes. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until solids turn pale golden brown, about 1 minute longer. Add the pounded garlic/ginger mixture and cook, stirring, until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add half of sliced scallions and turmeric and cook, stirring, until lightly softened, about 1 minute.

text: 2. Open 1 can of coconut milk and carefully spoon off about 3 tablespoons of the solid fat from the surface and place it in a large Dutch oven. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Heat over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until coconut fat separates and solids start to sizzle, about 4 minutes. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until solids turn pale golden brown, about 1 minute longer. Add the pounded garlic/ginger mixture and cook, stirring, until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add half of sliced scallions and turmeric and cook, stirring, until lightly softened, about 1 minute.

query: How should I prepare the pumpkins and squash for roasting?
text: 1. Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350F (180C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

To Stuff and Finish Pumpkins: Stuff pumpkins by evenly dividing and layering half the ingredients in the following order: mashed kabocha squash, bread, mushroom-kale mixture, pepitas, pecans, Gruyre, and spiced cream. text: 1. Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350F (180C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

text: 6. Bake until the bars are puffed and firm, without any significant browning, about 18 minutes. This will steam the cookies and retain moisture for them to reabsorb, creating a uniquely soft and cakey texture. query: what do I need to put the ingredients into? bowl is there a specific type of stand mixer that I need to use? stand mixer What ingredients should be mixed first to prepare the dough? butter, brown sugar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, honey, and orange zest  How long should I cream the mixture in the mixer? until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. How can I incorporate the egg yolks into the dough?
text: 1. Prepare the Dough: Combine butter, brown sugar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, honey, and orange zest in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Mix on low speed to moisten, then increase to medium and cream until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add orange juice, then add the egg yolks one at a time and continue beating until smooth. Reduce the speed to low and sprinkle in the flour, mixing until well combined.

query: How should I prepare the rice if it is day-old rice?
text: 1. If using day-old rice (see note), transfer to a medium bowl and break the rice up with your hands into individual grains before proceeding. Heat 1/2 tablespoon (7ml) vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add half of rice and cook, stirring and tossing, until the rice is pale brown and toasted and has a lightly chewy texture, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Repeat with another 1/2 tablespoon oil and remaining rice.

When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and arrange the coals on one side of the charcoal grate. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill, and allow to preheat for 5 minutes. how long should I preheat the grill? for 5 minutes what heat setting should I set the grill to? highest heat What are my preparations if I am using a gas grill? Set half the burners on a gas grill to the highest heat setting, cover, and preheat for 10 minutes. Clean and oil the grill grates. once covered how long should I preheat for? for 10 minutes How do I prepare the grill before starting the actual cooking?
text: 3. Light 1/2 chimney of charcoal. When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and arrange the coals on one side of the charcoal grate. Clean and oil the grill grates.

text: 4. Remove pork belly from marinade, wipe off excess, and pat dry with paper towels; discard marinade. Cook pork directly over the hot side of the grill. If using a charcoal grill, leave uncovered; if using a gas grill, cover. Cook, turning occasionally, until pork is cooked through and lightly charred on all sides and the thickest part registers 155F (68C) on an instant-read thermometer, between 20 to 25 minutes (if a flare-up occurs, quickly move pork to cooler side of grill; once flare-up subsides, move pork back to hotter side of grill and continue to cook). Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes; slice pork belly into 1-inch-wide by 2-inch-long strips.

Wrap tightly with plastic wrap. how many hours is the maximum time to marinate the pork? 24 hours how many hours as a minimum should I marinate the pork? 6 hours What should I do after lighting 1/2 chimney of charcoal? When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and arrange the coals on one side of the charcoal grate. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill, and allow to preheat for 5 minutes. how long should I preheat the grill? for 5 minutes what heat setting should I set the grill to? highest heat What are my preparations if I am using a gas grill? Set half the burners on a gas grill to the highest heat setting, cover, and preheat for 10 minutes. Clean and oil the grill grates. once covered how long should I preheat for? for 10 minutes How do I prepare the grill before starting the actual cooking? Clean and oil the grill grates. What should I do after I remove the pork belly from the marinade? Wipe off excess and pat dry with paper towels; discard marinade. What should I do if a flare-up occurs while grilling the pork? Quickly move pork to cooler side of grill; once flare-up subsides, move pork back to hotter side of grill and continue to cook. what should I do to the pork once it's cooked? pork what temperature should read on the thermometer so I know the pork is cooked? 68c how long should I cook the pork for? 25 minutes what ingredients go in the Bowl along with the sliced onion? garlic, vinegar, black pepper, salt, and sugar what ingredients go into the large bowl? sliced onion, garlic, vinegar, black pepper, salt, and sugar What kind of action is required to mix the ingredients in the large bowl? Stir until sugar and salt have fully dissolved when do I put the sugar in? sugar After creating the dressing, what do I do next for the Kilawin?

query: How should I prepare the rice if it is day-old rice?
text: 1. If using day-old rice (see note), transfer to a medium bowl and break the rice up with your hands into individual grains before proceeding. Heat 1/2 tablespoon (7ml) vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add half of rice and cook, stirring and tossing, until the rice is pale brown and toasted and has a lightly chewy texture, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Repeat with another 1/2 tablespoon oil and remaining rice.

query: How should I prepare the rice if it is day-old rice? If using day-old rice (see note), transfer to a medium bowl and break the rice up with your hands into individual grains before proceeding. What should I do before adding the rice to the heated oil in the wok?
text: 1. If using day-old rice (see note), transfer to a medium bowl and break the rice up with your hands into individual grains before proceeding. Heat 1/2 tablespoon (7ml) vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add half of rice and cook, stirring and tossing, until the rice is pale brown and toasted and has a lightly chewy texture, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Repeat with another 1/2 tablespoon oil and remaining rice.

query: what temperature should I heat the oven to? to 350f what type of knife should I use for this recipe? sharp paring knife What's next after cutting off the top of the pumpkin? query: what temperature should I heat the oven to? to 350f what type of knife should I use for this recipe? sharp paring knife What's next after cutting off the top of the pumpkin?
text: 1. Roast the Pumpkins and Squash: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat to 350F (180C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Working with one pumpkin at a time, use a sharp paring knife to cut the top of the pumpkin off in one piece (as when making a jack-o'-lantern). Carefully run knife along the cavity of the pumpkin to loosen seeds and stringy pulp, then use a spoon to scoop them out and scrape the cavity clean. Using the paring knife, scrape seeds and pulp from the tops as well. Discard seeds and pulp or reserve for another use (try roasting the seeds with one of our seasoning combinations for a snack). Repeat with remaining pumpkins.

query: How should I prepare the rice if it is day-old rice?
text: 1. If using day-old rice (see note), transfer to a medium bowl and break the rice up with your hands into individual grains before proceeding. Heat 1/2 tablespoon (7ml) vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking. Add half of rice and cook, stirring and tossing, until the rice is pale brown and toasted and has a lightly chewy texture, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Repeat with another 1/2 tablespoon oil and remaining rice.

text: 5. Heat oil in 12-inch stainless steel, well-seasoned cast iron, or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Using a large spoon, small ladle, or measuring cup, add batter in 3-tablespoon (1 1/2-ounce; 45ml) portions (you can make larger or smaller pancakes as desired) to hot oil. For thinner, crispier pancakes, press down on batter to flatten them out; for thicker, fluffier pancakes, leave batter undisturbed. Cook, swirling oil once or twice, until pancakes are golden brown and crispy on first side, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip pancakes and continue cooking, swirling oil once or twice, until second side is golden and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer pancakes to wire rack set in rimmed baking sheet or paper towel-lined plate and season with salt. Repeat process with remaining batter, adding more oil if pan becomes too dry. Serve pancakes hot with dipping sauce alongside.
